https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-363993-17mm-14x15-turner-black-zinc-coated-wheel-nut/,17mm 14x1.5 Turner Black Zinc-Coated Wheel Nut,001467ECSX5,In Stock,$2.33,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$2.45,17mm black lug nut to fit 14x1.5 thread wheel studs (common for most 2012+ BMWs). This is a super tough wheel stud nut in a standard 17mm size. The black finish is durable, corrosion-resistant, and stealthy so it blends in with dark-colored wheels. BMW designed their wheels to use a black bolt so more of the silver design 'pops' or is more eye-catching. These black wheel nuts preserve that effect. 17mm is the standard BMW bolt head size so you won't have to buy extra sockets. The seat is a standard diameter but may not fit all brands of wheels. If you have a small diameter bolt bore on your wheels, try our compact 19mm wheel nuts.   Priced per nut.",,

column1: https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-3137-19mm-12x15-turner-yellow-zinc-coated-race-wheel-nut/,19mm 12x1.5 Turner Yellow Zinc-Coated Race Wheel Nut,TWH9952R19,In Stock,$9.56,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$11.95,"Turner Motorsport’s five years of endurance competition has taught us many things. One was that not all lug-nuts are made the same. While the standard nuts that we sell are great for daily drivers, HPDE events, and club racing, a beefier and more durable nut was needed for the 3-hour, 6-hour, and 24-hour professional endurance races. During the 24 Hours of Daytona, our crew guys made over 80 tire changes in NASCAR-style pitstops. That kind of abuse from air guns and fast work required the ""next level"" of lug-nut. These nuts are a high-grade steel with a zinc coating and they incorporate several innovative features.   The wheel-side of the nut has recessed threads so that the nut has to be square to engage the threads. Without the recess, it’s far too easy to start the threads with the nut being crooked.   The 19mm head of the nut is slightly rounded to help the socket find its position.   The zinc plating that we use is reasonably durable without being excessive. With too much coating, the chipped and worn coating fragments can end up in the threads, leading to all sorts of trouble. Anyone who has used nuts repeatedly knows that the coating is not going to last forever. The constant abuse from air guns will chip it all away. So why add weight and the potential for disaster with excess coating? We did away with most of the danger from that with a lighter coating that still resists the tough environment of the track.",,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-4044-17mm-12x15-turner-silver-zinc-coated-wheel-nut/,17mm 12x1.5 Silver Zinc-Coated Wheel Nut - Single,L30038,In Stock,$1.69,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$2.25,"17mm lug nut to fit 12x1.5 thread wheel studs (common for most BMWs made before 2012). This is a super tough wheel stud nut in a standard 17mm size. The zinc finish is durable and bright so your eye catches it quick (important during fast pitstop tire changes). 17mm is the standard BMW bolt head size so you won't have to buy extra sockets. The seat is a standard diameter but may not fit all brands of wheels. If you have a small diameter bolt bore on your wheels, try our compact 19mm wheel nuts.   Priced per nut.",,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-373595-conical-seat-wheel-bolt-14x125x27mm-priced-each/,Conical Seat Wheel Bolt - 14x1.25x27mm,C17F27-ZNNITT,In Stock,$2.51,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$2.95,ECS Tuning lab tests its fasteners to ensure they meet all 10.9 specifications.,,
https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-184600-turner-motorsport-12x15-55mm-full-thread-wheel-stud-most-bmws-e30-e36-e46-e90-e92-etc/,Turner Motorsport 12x1.5 55mm Full Thread Wheel Stud - Most BMWs (E3...,TWH9950X55,In Stock,$12.30,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$12.95,Wheel studs are among the safest and beneficial upgrades you can make on a track car. Not only are wheel studs safer than wheel bolts but they make changing wheels/tires much easier. One of the frustrating things about installing your wheels on the hub is that it's difficult to line up the wheel on the bolt holes. As wheels get larger but also heavier it's even more trouble. Add in a wheel spacer and the task is twice as hard. BMW does produce a wheel alignment pin for this purpose but if you're changing wheels often a stud conversion is the better way to go. With studs you won't have to worry about dropping your expensive wheels onto the brake rotor.   Not all wheel studs are created equal. We don't take a manufacturer's generic wheel stud from their catalog and call it our own. Turner Wheel Studs are designed to our own specifications and manufactured for us exclusively. Beware of cheaper studs on the market! We have seen other studs similar to our own designs that are not a true BMW fitment. There are differences that we have ironed out over our years of selling wheel studs for the BMW market. Our stud prices may be slightly higher than the rock bottom prices on the web but we promise that it's a higher quality.    These wheel studs are the same as our hugely popular Bullet Nose studs but with threads along the full length of the stud. This gives you more threaded area for tightening wheel nuts or allows the use of a closed-end wheel nut. These also have a more OEM appearance. Although these are a lower cost version of our Bullet Nose studs, they are every bit as strong, durable, and safe. The Bullet Nose is an upgrade because it's easier to install and almost impossible to cross-thread a nut.",,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-340499-turner-motorsport-12x15-bullet-nose-wheel-stud-most-bmws-1984-2011-e30-e36-e46-e9x/,Turner Motorsport 12x1.5 Bullet Nose Wheel Stud - Most BMWs 1984-201...,TWH9950,In Stock,$99.86,View More Info,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$102.95,"Wheel studs are among the safest and most beneficial upgrades you can make on a track car. Not only are wheel studs safer than wheel bolts but they make changing wheels/tires much easier. One of the frustrating things about installing your wheels on the hub is that it's difficult to line up the wheel on the bolt holes. As wheels get larger but also heavier it's even more trouble. Add in a wheel spacer and the task is twice as hard. BMW does produce a wheel alignment pin for this purpose but if you're changing wheels often a stud conversion is the better way to go. Our original bullet nose studs are available in 78mm and 90mm overall lengths. The 78mm works great for cars that do not use a spacer (or a spacer smaller than 15mm). We recommend the 90mm length for cars that have a spacer larger than 15mm. These studs come with a black magnesium phosphate coating for excellent corrosion resistance. These studs are perfect for dual-purpose street/track cars. The studs are stronger and safer than wheel bolts and have a barrier against corrosion which makes them suitable for street use. For a dedicated race or track car, where wheel changes or pit stops are more frequent, check out our racing dry lube studs. Our studs are also designed and manufactured with the properly sized shank to work with a wider range of BMW wheel, nut, and brake rotor combinations. We intentionally avoid the extra large shoulders you see on other studs because they can interfere with some brake rotor hats. The extra-large shoulder can be too large to allow the rotor to pass through and drilling out the holes is required (not cool!) Our studs have the sufficient shank for the brake rotor without interfering.",,Starting at

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-16005-36136765546-genuine-bmw-part/,Genuine BMW Wheels Bolt Adapter - Code 33,36136765546,In Stock,$11.79,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$13.44,"This is a wheel lug adapter that will allow you to use a standard lug wrench to remove your locking wheel bolts. It functions as a key for locking wheel bolts. If yours is missing, verify your code to make sure you're ordering the proper adapter.",,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-215382-turbo-lock-red-high-strength-threadlocker-10ml-bottle/,Turbo-Lock Red High-Strength Threadlocker (10ml Bottle),12-010BC,In Stock,$5.95,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,,"Threadlocker is essential when doing any work to your car, especially prepping it for the track. Loose bolts should never happen! If you are a do-it-youselfer, or do much wrench turning, then you know about threadlocker (generically known as ""locktite"" or by the brand name Loctite). You also know a little goes a long way. This small bottle of Palm Labs Turbo-Lock red threadlock is perfect for that small job -- or a few small jobs! This tube has 10 mL (0.34 fluid ounces) of high-temp, high-strength threadlocker. This bottle comes with two ways to apply: with a squeeze or with the included brush. There are just too many different uses for this, and no mechanic or DIYer, should be without some in his or her toolbox.   Red or Blue threadlocker? Red is the highest strength so use it when the fastener will not be removed regularly or ever again. The Red will need a great amount of force to break free and maybe even heat. Blue is the medium strength and will break free with hand tools. Use it for fasteners that need extra locking protection but will be removed / disassmebled on a semi-regular basis.   Palm Labs Turbo-Lock Series 13-OR Features:",,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-340335-wheel-bolt-for-bmw-14x150-black-e53-e65-e83/,"Wheel Bolt for BMW - 14x1.50 - Black - E53, E65, E83",TMS184007,In Stock,$2.66,View More Info,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$2.95,If you are installing wheel spacers you will need longer bolts to accommodate the extra width. BMW changed their wheel bolt specs around 2006 to use a larger diameter bolt with a rare thread pitch. These 14 x 1.50 mm black wheel bolts are correct for the models listed below and have a 17mm head (same as stock). Watch out if you're buying spacers and bolts for these cars as some other retailers are still not up on the change... https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-568649-ecs-tuning-titanium-wheel-bolt-sets-14x125-f2223-f3x-e7071-f0102-f0607101213-f1516-f8x-g11-g30/,ECS Tuning Titanium Wheel Bolt Sets - 14x1.25 - F22/23 F3X E70/71 F0...,14125TWB,In Stock,$167.60,View More Info,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions#,$209.50,If you are a performance-minded enthusiast looking to save weight wherever possible or just want a set of very high quality wheel bolts that won't rust, ECS Titanium Wheel Bolts are exactly what you need. ECS Titanium Wheel Bolts are 50% lighter than steel bolts of the same size, thus reducing rotational mass on the vehicle. They are CNC'd from annealed titanium alloy and when tested to class 10.9 fastener proof load requirements, they showed no signs of fatigue or failure. Bolt Specifications: Diameter: 14mm Thread Pitch: 1.25mm Length: 27mm, 35mm, 40mm, 45mm Head: 17mm Seat: Conical Seat Before installing ECS Titanium Wheel Bolts on your vehicle, please ensure the threads on the hub are thoroughly cleaned to remove traces of zinc from previously installed wheel bolts. Any zinc left behind can lead to fatigue and cracking of the titanium alloy. *When installing wheel spacers, add the size of the spacer to the length of the OE wheel bolt for proper fitment (ex. 27mm Length OE Wheel Bolt + 15mm Wheel Spacer = Requires a 42mm Length Bolt)",,Starting at

column1: https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-379477-conical-seat-locking-wheel-bolt-kit/,ECS Tuning Conical Seat Locking Wheel Bolt Kit - Set of 4,003901ECS38CB,"Inventory On Order, ETA Oct 1, 2021",$40.46,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,$53.95,This kit includes 4 locking wheel bolts and 1 unique key that are lab tested to meet or exceed ISO 898 class 10.9 mechanical and physical properties to ensure perfect fastening of the wheel to the hub with no issues or potential to snap under aggressive driving conditions.,,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-178007-19mm-12x15-turner-silver-zinc-coated-compact-wheel-nut/,19mm 12x1.5 Turner Silver Zinc-Coated Compact Wheel Nut,TWH9952345,"Expected Ship Date:  Oct 13, 2021",$2.21,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,$2.95,"19mm compact lug nut to fit 12x1.5 thread wheel studs (common for most BMWs made before 2012). This wheel nut has a reduced outer flange for a more compact and minimal fitment. On many wheels, the hole for the lugbolt or lugnut is a very narrow diameter. Not even the stock lugbolt will fit through and these wheels often come with their own lugbolts. Then when adding studs to the car the options for a small diameter lug nut are very limited. We ran into this problem over and over and finally found a solution! These compact lugs have all of the material of a 19mm nut but without the flange of a standard wheel nut. For this reason we do not recommend using these on a wheel that normally takes a standard bolt seat (the seat is very important to the strength and integrity of the design). But for wheels that are designed to use a small seat, these are the solution! Bright and durable zinc finish makes them easy to spot during fast pitstop tire changes.   Priced per nut.  Thin-wall 19mm socket may be required depending on your wheel design.",,
https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-338601-wheel-bolt-12x150-silver-for-most-1975-2012-bmw-minis/,"Wheel Bolt - 12x1.50 - Silver - For Most 1975-2012 BMW, MINIs

...",TMS338601,"Expected Ship Date:  Oct 12, 2021",$22.10,View More Info,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,$29.50,"Whether you are looking to replace your old stock wheel lug bolts, or need longer bolts to accommodate wheel spacers or for other special considerations, our silver wheel bolts are probably what you need. They are high grade (10.9) and feature a durable bright silver finish. These are 12 x 1.5mm bolts with a 17mm head -- as used on most BMWs. Replaces BMW part numbers 36136781150 and 36131095390.",,Starting at

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-67356-36131181268-genuine-bmw-part/,Genuine BMW Single Wheel Lock Bolt - Code 18,36131181268,"Expected Ship Date:  Oct 20, 2021",$25.67,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,,Genuine BMW WHEEL BOLT WITH CODE,,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-189775-19mm-14x15-turner-yellow-zinc-coated-race-wheel-nut/,19mm 14x1.5 Yellow Zinc-Coated Race Wheel Nut,TWH9972YR4,"Inventory On Order, ETA Oct 25, 2021",$4.95,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,,"Turner Motorsport�s years of endurance competition has taught us many things. One was that not all lug-nuts are made the same. While the standard nuts that we sell are great for daily drivers, HPDE events, and club racing, a beefier and more durable nut was needed for the 3-hour, 6-hour, and 24-hour professional endurance races. During the 24 Hours of Daytona, our crew guys made over 80 tire changes in NASCAR-style pitstops. That kind of abuse from air guns and fast work required the ""next level"" of lug-nut. These nuts are a high-grade steel with a zinc coating and they incorporate several innovative features.   The wheel-side of the nut has recessed threads so that the nut has to be square to engage the threads. Without the recess, it�s far too easy to start the threads with the nut being crooked.   The 19mm head of the nut is slightly rounded to help the socket find its position.   The zinc plating that we use is reasonably durable without being excessive. With too much coating, the chipped and worn coating fragments can end up in the threads, leading to all sorts of trouble. Anyone who has used nuts repeatedly knows that the coating is not going to last forever. The constant abuse from air guns will chip it all away. So why add weight and the potential for disaster with excess coating? We did away with most of the danger from that with a lighter coating that still resists the tough environment of the track.",,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-304022-tms304022/,Turner Motorsport 12x1.5 90mm Full Thread Wheel Stud - Most BMWs (E3...,TWH9950X90,"Inventory On Order, ETA Nov 1, 2021",$11.35,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,$11.95,,,

https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-340354-msi-12x15-bullet-nose-racing-wheel-studs-with-dry-lube-most-bmws-1984-2011-e30-e36-e46-e9x/,MSI 12x1.5 Bullet Nose Racing Wheel Studs with Dry Lube - Most BMWs ...,MSI-M12X15,"Inventory On Order, ETA Nov 1, 2021",$10.95,View More Info,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,,Wheel studs are among the safest and most beneficial upgrades you can make on a track car. Not only are wheel studs safer than wheel bolts but they make changing wheels/tires much easier. One of the frustrating things about installing your wheels on the hub is that it's difficult to line up the wheel on the bolt holes. As wheels get larger but also heavier it's even more trouble. Add in a wheel spacer and the task is twice as hard. BMW does produce a wheel alignment pin for this purpose but if you're changing wheels often a stud conversion is the better way to go.,,Starting at
https://www.turnermotorsport.com/p-641936-wheel-stud-conversion-kit/,"Vargas Turbo Wheel Stud Conversion Kit - G2X, A90/A91 Supra

...",M14125-STUD,"Expected Ship Date:  Nov 2, 2021",$109.00,Add to Cart,,https://www.turnermotorsport.com/c-146-bmw-wheel-bolts-stud-conversions?No=50&Nrpp=50#,,Wheel studs are among the safest and beneficial upgrades you can make on a track car. Not only are wheel studs safer than wheel bolts but they make changing wheels/tires much easier. One of the frustrating things about installing your wheels on the hub is that it's difficult to line up the wheel on the bolt holes. As wheels get larger but also heavier it's even more trouble. Add in a wheel spacer and the task is twice as hard. BMW does produce a wheel alignment pin for this purpose but if you're changing wheels often a stud conversion is the better way to go. With studs you won't have to worry about dropping your expensive wheels onto the brake rotor. This kit includes: M14x1.25 to M14x1.50 CONVERSION Wheel studs in Gold Zinc (20) M14x.1..5 19mm Black opened ended lug nuts (20) *Note: Apply Medium duty lock-tite to the studs (short thread end) and torque to 25 ft/lb. Lug nuts should be torqued to OEM specifications. For your safety retorque all hardware (studs and nuts) after 25-50 Miles,,
